Package org.openlca.core.matrix.format

Interface Matrix

All Superinterfaces:
Copyable<MatrixReader>, MatrixReader
All Known Implementing Classes:
CompressedRowMatrix, DenseMatrix, HashPointMatrix, JavaMatrix
public interface Matrix extends MatrixReader
Interface with the general matrix operations used in openLCA.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    Matrix
    copy()
     
    default void
    scaleColumns​(double[] v)
    Scales the columns of this matrix in-place with the given factors $v$; this is like $M = M diagm(v)$.
    void
    set​(int row, int col, double val)
    Set the entry in the given row and column to the given value.
    default void
    setValues​(double[][] values)
    Fills the matrix with the given values.

    • set

      Set the entry in the given row and column to the given value.

    • copy

      Matrix copy()
      Specified by:
      copy in interface Copyable<MatrixReader>

    • setValues

      default void setValues​(double[][] values)
      Fills the matrix with the given values.
      Parameters:
      values - The values as an array of rows (row-major order). The number of rows and columns of the given values may be smaller or larger than the rows and columns of this matrix; only the matching cells are set.

    • scaleColumns

      default void scaleColumns​(double[] v)
      Scales the columns of this matrix in-place with the given factors $v$; this is like $M = M diagm(v)$. Specifically for sparse matrices this should be implemented in a more efficient way.
